plan: In the next few rounds, I plan to closely watch the market price trends and attempt to buy stocks when they are priced below 14, given that each stock will ultimately convert to 14 cash. I will aim to sell stocks if they're valued significantly higher than 14, ideally around 16 or above, to capture the difference before the final conversion. Additionally, I'll consider buying stocks if the dividend potential seems high (expectation of frequent high dividends) to boost cash reserves for endgame conversion.
insight: A critical strategy is understanding the intrinsic value of a stock as 14 cash at the end of the experiment and balancing that against interim dividend profits. Timing in the market and anticipation of price movements will be key. This practice round will inform us about volatility and trends in stock pricing, potentially guiding more aggressive or conservative trading strategies. Order placement should account for current holdings and forecasted price adjustments, aiming to optimize earnings.

plan: Given the lack of executed trades in the previous round, I will attempt to buy more aggressively near 12-13 to see if trades can be executed while maintaining sell prices above 15 to potentially capitalize on profits if the market leans bullish. plan: I will attempt to engage in more active trading by placing buy orders slightly above previous attempts (around 13-14) to capture potential downward movements in market price. insight: The previous practice rounds suggest a possibility of a static market with participants holding firm on certain price levels.
